alert.note: Alert for North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 30 at 1:49PM PST until February 01 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM WEDNESDAY TO 7 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches with 2 or more feet expected on peaks and ridgelines. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph over higher terrain. Snowfall rates will be highest Wednesday evening into Thursday morning. * WHERE...Areas of Siskiyou County at and above 4000 feet, including ridgelines in the Siskiyou Mountain Range and higher terrain around Mount Shasta. Affected roadways include Highway 89 near Snowmans Summit and Highway 3 south of Callahan. * WHEN...From 4 AM Wednesday to 7 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light accumulations of snow are possible as low as 3500 feet early Thursday morning, which may affect portions of Interstate 5. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
